intro: Oldenlandia fastigiata var. fastigiata, commonly known as the upright oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an annual or perennial herb. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers clustered in cymes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and clusters of tiny flowers.
